tuv.seg: Politihkalaš eiseválddit - ráđđehus ja Stuorradiggi – dat dahket mearrádusaid.
The economy - regjeringen.no
Beavttálmahttet ja nannejit vearu bearrama
The economy
Ráđđehus ovddida odne ođastusa, mainna beavttálmahttet almmolaš suorggi ja geahpedit dan byrokratiija.
In the Government, it is the Minister of Finance ’ s responsibility to draw up and coordinate economic policy.
Vearu bearrama árvalit sirdit gielddaid vearrogáibideddjiin Vearroetáhtii.
The Ministry of Finance acts as the secretariat for the Minister of Finance.
Vearuid ja divadiid mearrideapmi, bearran ja dárkkisteapmi čohkkejuvvo ovtta etáhtii.
It is the political authorities - the Government and the Storting – that make the decisions.
Nu nannejit earret eará Vearroetáhta dáistaleami čáhppes barggu vuostá.
On this page you will find general information and documents relating to the economy.

[Preassadieđáhus, Justiisa- ja gearggusvuođadepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
Introductory speech at EU Heads of Mission meeting
Gieldaođastus nannen dihte boahtteáiggi čálggu
Oslo, 9 th September 2014
[Preassadieđáhus, Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
[Speech / article, Ministry of Finance, 09.09.2014]
Ođastusa mihttu lea fámolaš gielddat mat ožžot eanet bargamušaid ja iešstivrejumi.
" I am very glad to be here because European cooperation is so important to us, both economically and politically.
Gaskal 4,2 ja 4,5 miljárdda kruvnnu leat friddjaboađut.
The EU and EU member countries are among our closest partners.
[Preassadieđáhus, Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
The geopolitical crisis in Ukraine has reminded us how important it is to stay together and defend our values ", said Minister of Finance, Siv Jensen.
Ođđa diehtosiidu Norgga gielddaid birra
Mandate for a new green tax commission
[Preassadieđáhus, Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
[Article, Ministry of Finance, 27.06.2014]
Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta almmuha dál ođđa neahttasiiddu gos gielddat ja eará berošteaddjit sáhttet gávdnat áigeguovdilis dieđuid gielddaid birra.

The commission is mandated to evaluate whether and how a green tax reform can be used to promote improved resource utilisation and the achievement of the objectives contained in the cross-party broad agreement on climate policy.
Láigoviesuid erenoamáš áŋgiruššan
Countercyclical buffer unchanged
[Preassadieđáhus, Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
[Press release, Ministry of Finance, 27.06.2014]
- Eanaš Norgga ássiin lea buorre ássandilli. Muhto gávdnojit maiddái olbmot geain lea heajos eallindilli.
The Ministry of Finance has today decided to keep the level of the countercyclical capital buffer for banks unchanged.
Nanne digitála dorvvolašvuođa
This is in line with advice from Norges Bank.
– Ráđđehus áigu nannet barggu olaheames dorvvolaš digitála árgabeaivvi sihke fitnodagaide ja ássiide.
The Financial Supervisory Authority has stated that it concurs with the advice.
30 miljovnna ruvnno fitnodatálggaheapmái ja ođđaháhkamii
The Expert Group on investments in coal and petroleum companies invites to a stakeholder meeting
[Preassadieđáhus, Ealáhus- ja guolástusdepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
[News story, Ministry of Finance, 03.06.2014]
– Mii háliidat eanet čeahpes fitnodatálggaheddjiid ja eanet ja eanet kommersialiseremis dutkama jurdagiid, cealká ealáhusministtar Monica Mæland.
The Ministry of Finance has appointed an expert group to assess the Government Pension Fund Global ' s (GPFG) appropriate use of policy instruments and investments in coal and petroleum companies.
Fitnodatálggaheami ja ođđaháhkama vuoruheami olis lassána juolludeapmi 30 miljovnna ruvnnuin.

The Storting (the Norwegian parliament) has asked the government to establish the group, which will evaluate whether the exclusion of coal and petroleum companies is a more effective strategy for addressing climate issues in the management of the GPFG than the exercise of ownership and exertion of influence.
Eanet dokumeanttat fáttá birra
The IMF presents views on the Norwegian economy
Beavttálmahttet ja nannejit vearu bearrama
Webcast from the press conference
[Preassadieđáhus, Ruhtadandepartemeanta, 23.06.2014]
[Sound and image, Ministry of Finance, 23.05.2014]
Vearu bearrama árvalit sirdit gielddaid vearrogáibideddjiin Vearroetáhtii. Áiggi mielde dat sáhttá geahpedit bargiid logu sullii 500:in.
A mission from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) presented its views on the Norwegian economy and Norwegian economic policy.
Vearuid ja divadiid mearrideapmi, bearran ja dárkkisteapmi čohkkejuvvo ovtta etáhtii. Nu nannejit earret eará Vearroetáhta dáistaleami čáhppes barggu vuostá.
The mission ’ s report is supportive of the government ’ s fiscal policy and suggests that changes to the Norwegian tax system could further boost both productivity and economic growth.
Ođđa gielddat mielde ja olles buhtadus
The IMF presents views on the Norwegian economy
[Preassadieđáhus, Ruhtadandepartemeanta, 06.06.2014]
[Press release, Ministry of Finance, 23.05.2014]
- Ráđđehus háliida nannet norgga ekonomiija ovdánannávccaid ja sihkkarastit olles riikii árvoráhkadeami, ruhtadanministtar Siv Jensen dadjala.
Today a mission from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) presented its views on the Norwegian economy and Norwegian economic policy.
Odne Ráđđehus árvala 233 gieldda ealáhusaide vuolit bargoaddidivada suoidnemánu 1. beaivvi rájes ja árvala buhtadandoaimmaid sektoriidda, mat gártet ortnega olggobeallái.
The mission ’ s report is supportive of the government ’ s fiscal policy and suggests that changes to the Norwegian tax system could further boost both productivity and economic growth.
Gieldaođastus nannen dihte boahtteáiggi čálggu
Local government reform to secure future welfare
[Preassadieđáhus, Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
[Press release, Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation, 14.05.2014]
Ráđđehus almmuha dán stuoradiggeáigodagas dievaslaš gieldaođastusplána gieldaproposišuvnna bokte.
The Local Government White Paper contains the Government ’ s comprehensive plan for local government reform during this Storting session.
Ođastusa mihttu lea fámolaš gielddat mat ožžot eanet bargamušaid ja iešstivrejumi.
The reform will result in larger municipalities that can take on additional responsibilities and more autonomy.
Gielddasuorgái árvaluvvo 4,5 – 5 miljárdda eanet 2015:s
Additional NOK 166 million for humanitarian assistance
[Preassadieđáhus, Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
[Press release, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 14.05.2014]
Gaskal 4,2 ja 4,5 miljárdda kruvnnu leat friddjaboađut.
‘ The need for humanitarian assistance is greater in 2014 than ever before.
Boahttejagi gielddaođastusa oktavuođas ráđđehus árvala fylkkagielddaide ođđa dienasvuogádaga.
In the revised national budget, the Government proposes an increase of NOK 166 million in allocations for this purpose.
Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta almmuha dál ođđa neahttasiiddu gos gielddat ja eará berošteaddjit sáhttet gávdnat áigeguovdilis dieđuid gielddaid birra.
This will enable us to provide more emergency aid for South Sudan, Syria and other crisis areas, ’ said Minister of Foreign Affairs Børge Brende.
Láigoviesuid erenoamáš áŋgiruššan
The Revised National Budget 2014 - A budget for growth
[Preassadieđáhus, Gielda- ja ođasmahttindepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
[Press release, Ministry of Finance, 14.05.2014]
- Eanaš Norgga ássiin lea buorre ássandilli.
- The Government took the first steps towards a change in policy direction in the amended fiscal budget for 2014.
Muhto gávdnojit maiddái olbmot geain lea heajos eallindilli.
In the revised budget we continue along this path.
Láigovisttiid erenoamáš áŋgiruššan galgá mielddisbuktit ahte eanet ássit ožžot buorre ássanviesu, cealká gielda- ja ođasmahttinministtar Jan Tore Sanner.

Targeted tax reductions, high priority on infrastructure and other measures to stimulate productivity and employment, are important to stimulate growth of the Norwegian economy, says the Finance Minister Siv Jensen.
[Preassadieđáhus, Ealáhus- ja guolástusdepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
Regulation and decision on systemically important financial institutions
[Preassadieđáhus, Ealáhus- ja guolástusdepartemeanta, 14.05.2014]
[Press release, Ministry of Finance, 12.05.2014]
– Mii háliidat eanet čeahpes fitnodatálggaheddjiid ja eanet ja eanet kommersialiseremis dutkama jurdagiid, cealká ealáhusministtar Monica Mæland.
The Norwegian Ministry of Finance has today adopted a regulation on the identification of systemically important financial institutions in Norway.
Fitnodatálggaheami ja ođđaháhkama vuoruheami olis lassána juolludeapmi 30 miljovnna ruvnnuin.
This is a follow-up of the capital requirements legislation adopted by the Storting (the Norwegian Parliament) last year.
